results.name: The modified Collatz map considered by Vaillant and Delarue.
comment: This is a modified Collatz-Terras map (A060322), called in the Vaillant and Delarue link f.
The Collatz conjecture: iterations of the map f = a: N_0 -> N_0 with n -> a(n) lead always to 0.
The minimal number k with a^{[k]}(n) = 0 is given by A324037(n).
The tree CfTree, related to this map, giving the branches which lead to 0 for each vertex label of level n >= 0 is given in A324246.
link: Nicolas Vaillant and Philippe Delarue, The hidden face of the 3x+1 problem. Part I: Intrinsic algorithm, April 26 2019.
formula: a(n) = (3*n+1)/2 if n is odd, 3*n/4 if n == 0 (mod 4), and (n-2)/4 if n == 2 (mod 4).
results.author: Nicolas Vaillant, Philippe Delarue, _Wolfdieter Lang_, May 09 2019
